definition: pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
tube/cylinder/to encase in sth cylindrical (such as hands in sleeves etc)

sentences.english: I want to make a penholder with this bamboo.
sentences.chinese: 我要把这根竹子做成一个笔筒。

sentences.english: The left pocket incorporates a dual pass-through slot for pens, chem-lights and tire gauges.
sentences.chinese: 左口袋采用了双传递笔筒槽，化学，仪表灯和轮胎。

sentences.english: Ran into her mother's office, took a new toy pen and ran.
sentences.chinese: 跑进妈妈的办公室，拿了一个新玩具笔筒就跑。

sentences.english: Penholder due to ease of use, quickly swept the world, is still not bad-sheng.
sentences.chinese: 笔筒因使用方便，很快就风靡天下，至今仍盛而不衰。

sentences.english: This openwork porcelain brush pot is decorated with a dragon, a traditional symbol of power.
sentences.chinese: 这镂空瓷笔筒装饰有龙，传统的权力象征。

sentences.english: The shaft of this pen is solid gold.
sentences.chinese: 这种笔的笔筒是足金的。

definition: water pot or goblet (for Chinese calligraphy)
case for an ink stone or ink slab
small cup for adding water to an ink stone
the cap of a pen, pencil or writing brush/the sheath of a pen (made of cloth, silk or thread)
Four Treasures of the Study, namely 筆|笔[bi3], 墨[mo4], 紙|纸[zhi3] and 硯|砚[yan4]/the essentials of calligraphy and scholarship (idiom)
a small table to accommodate an incense burner
